markdownRemark.html:
I was reading this editorial about a new Broadcom chip - the BCM2157. Let’s see what we have here:

  • Dual core
  • top speed of 800mhz
  • Supports wifi hotspot
  • Low power
  • Android 2.2

The suggested MRP for a smartphone made using this chipset is $100 - not the cost price, but the cost after profit accounting.

This is huge - I just dont see how RIM or Nokia can top this. Hell… the iphone will have a hard time topping this, but you need to account for the reality distortion field.

The biggest growth in mobiles is gonna come from Asia - India and China being the two fastest growing mobile markets. This price point is spot on for these markets.
